results.title: Protest projection on Twitter HQ
results.brief_description: On November 18, self-described ‘projection activist’ Alan Marling used a neighboring building to project messages of protest and disdain towards Elon Musk, on to the facade of Twitter HQ in San Francsisco. Phrases such as, “Musk’s Hellscape” and “Worthless billionare’ were projected in large white text across the building for over an hour to call in to question Musk’s ethics, investments and further highlight the current conditions of his employees at Twitter since he toko over the company in October. Marling began protesting outside Twitter HQ back in 2017 to stand against Donald Trump’s presidency and use of Twitter as public platform.
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Lawless oligarch. Worthless billionaire. Space Karen. These are just some of the labels activist Alan Marling projected onto Twitter’s San Francisco HQ to describe new owner Elon Musk. The scrolling text questioned Musk’s ethics, investments and treatment of employees after taking over the company in October. On Twitter itself, the vibe was apocalyptic, with many users lamenting the end (using the hashtag #RIPTwitter) and Musk’s unbanning of controversial figures like Donald Trump. This real-world projection protest reflects the kinds of commentary users are making about the site’s new overlord.
description_for_label: Lawless oligarch. Worthless billionaire. Space Karen. These are just some of the labels activist Alan Marling projected onto Twitter’s San Francisco HQ to describe new owner Elon Musk. The scrolling text questioned Musk’s ethics, investments and treatment of employees after taking over the company in October. On Twitter itself, the vibe was apocalyptic, with many users lamenting the end and Musk’s unbanning of controversial figures like Donald Trump. This real-world projection protest reflects the kinds of commentary users are making on the site about its new overlord.

results.title: Restoration
results.creator_credit: Christine Hansen, Kate Riedl, Cordelia Beresford and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
On a remote New South Wales property in 1912, the image was captured of a young woman who worked as a maid. Her calm gaze hid passions that emerged to subvert her fate. In Restoration fragments of memory combine in photography and dance to retell her story.
Narelle Benjamin (the maid) and Solon Ulbrich (the photographer) also choreographed the dance sequences.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christine Hansen, Kate Riedl, Cordelia Beresford and AFTRS

results.title: Project X
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Kaplan, Lawrence Lasker, Walter Parkes and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Pilot Jimmy Garrett (Mathew Broderick) finds himself working on a special military assignment as punishment when he is grounded for misconduct. His mission is to teach chimpanzees to fly through the use of flight simulators, and he quickly discovers an affinity with the animals who he begins communicating with. When he befriends researcher Teri (Helen Hunt) and her number one student, a chimpanzee called Virgil she has successfully taught sign language to, Garrett discovers something that wasn’t in the brief - the real purpose of “Project X” is to test the limits of human endurance by subjecting the experimental primates to radiation. Teri and Jimmy are forced to question their loyalties to science, their careers, and the animals that have become friends. Cast also includes Bill Sadler, Johnny Ray McGhee and Jonathan Stark.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jonathan Kaplan, Lawrence Lasker, Walter Parkes and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation

results.title: Project Vlad
results.creator_credit: Luke Dunn Gielmuda, Aaron Rogers and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
“Sometime in the early 50S the Soviet Space Agency launched Project Vlad. Details are sketchy, but it was a top secret mission. Shrouded in secrecy, few records were kept and the Project has since been all but forgotten…”
Vlad is a Russian chimpanzee cosmonaut. Sent into orbit as a prelude to manned space flight, his hopes for heroism have long since faded. Vlad is a victim of Cold War politics; a long forgotten anachronism whose fate is to trace an endless and lonely trajectory around the Earth.
Project Vlad was created digitally on a Silicon Graphics O2/Infinite Reality Engine using Maya 1.5 and Flame 5.5 software. It was then transferred to 35mm film using a Solitair Film Recorder.

results.title: Little echo lost
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Jane Keneally and Armagan Ballantyne
results.brief_description: The EchoMan has never questioned his existence till now. One day he witnesses an event that brings into question everything he stands for and believes in. Stars Hugo Weaving as the EchoMan and Alana de Roma as the young girl. Original format 35mm.

results.title: Flux
results.brief_description:
A film about trust, about an accident, about falling out of love and about emerging from grief. Flux was created entirely on a desktop Macintosh using Adobe AfterEffects and Adobe Photoshop. It was then transferred to 35mm film using a Solitair Film Recorder. It is listed by Lynden Barber (film critic for The Australian newspaper) as one of ‘12 Film Breakthroughs’ for its achievement as the first Australian film post-produced entirely on a home computer.
WARNING: This film contains scenes that may disturb some viewers.

results.title: Bound
results.creator_credit: Daniella Ortega, Serhat Caradee and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
A boy, a dead body, a relentless pursuit – it’s not what you see, it’s how you see it.
Bound is an urban tragedy about a boy who is mistakenly shot by the police. Jumping back and forth in time to reveal instincts colliding and lives unravelling in a world that rushes on regardless, this film is about what happens when you make all the wrong decisions for the right reasons.

results.title: Project out of school: planning a quality service
results.creator_credit: Alex Jaye, Suzanne Cecil-Fizdale, Maryla Juchnowski and Video Media Production
results.brief_description: Provides the considerations for planning quality out of school programs both before and after school. Shows a number of active programs, emphasises the advantages of holding such programs, and illustrates ways of involving parents, children and staff. Appropriate for Professional Development and Personal Development (Home Economics) at VCE level
